translated: For five hundred times I was a king of the gods,ğŸ”½for three hundred times I was a king of the world,
and innumerable times I was a king of a small country.
Wandering through existence after existence,
I obtained great wealth;
I never had a lack of wealth,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I wander through two existences,
among the gods and among men;
I do not know of any other state of existence,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I am reborn in two families,
in the families of nobles and brahmins;
I do not know of a low family,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I obtain an elephant-carriage, a horse-carriage,
a palanquin carried by men,
I obtain all of these,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I obtain a group of female slaves, a group of male slaves,
Women adorned with ornaments;
I obtain all of these,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Silk, woolen, linen, and cotton;
I obtain all of these,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
New clothes, new fruits,
new food with new flavors;
I obtain all of these,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Eat this, enjoy this,
sleep on this bed;
I obtain all of these,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Everywhere I am worshipped,
my fame is greatly exalted;
I always have a great following,
my retinue is always inseparable;
I am the foremost of my relatives,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I do not know cold or heat,
fever does not exist for me;
And mental suffering,
does not exist in my heart.
Having become golden-colored,
I wander through existence and rebirth;
I do not know ugliness,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Having fallen from the deva world,
urged on by the root of merit,
I was born in the city of Savatthi,
in a great house, in the middle.
Abandoning the five strands of sense pleasure,
I went forth into homelessness;
Seven years after my birth,
I attained perfection.
The Buddha, who had reached perfection,
who had vision, who knew my qualities,
Though young, I was worthy of worship;
this is the result of worshipping the Buddha.
